bibl.title: Phrygian Tales.
bibl.note: See pp. 226-229: on the "Phrygian writings" that Cicero (De natura deorum 3.42) and Plutarch (De Iside et Osiride 29, 362B) associate with the Egyptian Herakles, son of Nilus and father or grandfather of Typhon and perhaps of other divinities associated with Isis.
bibl.seg: See pp. 226-229: on the "Phrygian writings" that Cicero (De natura deorum 3.42) and Plutarch (De Iside et Osiride 29, 362B) associate with the Egyptian Herakles, son of Nilus and father or grandfather of Typhon and perhaps of other divinities associated with Isis.
